statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -15 \\ -3 \\ 15 \\ -3 \\ -15 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -15 \\ -3 \\ 15 \\ -3 \\ -15 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
